1.SceneDescription:
Chandler, Joey, and Ross's apartment, Ross is cleaning out the fridge. Joey
walks from his room. He looks like he just woke up.

lines.Line:
I...reorganized the fridge. See, bottom shelf: meats and dairy.
(There’s nothing on the shelf.) Middle shelf: fruits and vegetables. (There’s
one lone tomato.) And top shelf: expired products. (The shelf is jammed packed.

Because I am bored...Out of my mind. I’ve already been to the
bank, post office, and the dry cleaners

Dude, you just described seven days worth of stuff. You’ve got to
spread it out a little, you know. Haven’t you ever been unemployed
Hey, I am not unemployed. I’m on sabbatical
Hey, I am not unemployed. I’m on sabbatical
Hey, I am not unemployed. I’m on sabbatical

Hey, don’t get religious on me, ok. (Ross looks a little
confused.) A guy in your position needs to be a little better at relaxing. You know. Why
do you think we have the comfortable chairs? Huh...come here…sit down. (Ross sits
down.) Ready? (Joey flips the foot rest up.) Ahh!! (He reclines the chair fully.) Ohh,
yeah!! Huh?

Ohh, no, no. We’re not going to just sit. (Joey sits down and
hits the speed dial button on the phone.) Shhh. (It begins to ring.
(Answering the phone at work) Hello, Chandler Bing
(Answering the phone at work) Hello, Chandler Bing
(In a high pitched female voice) Hello Mr. Bing...I love you

(Angrily) Alright, whoever this is, stop calling me! (Ross and
Joey laugh silently.) It’s been six months! It’s not funny

Leave me alone! For the love of God, leave me alone!!!
(Joey hangs up.
And that’s Wednesday. (He reclines in his chair.) Ohh
And that’s Wednesday. (He reclines in his chair.) Ohh

2.SceneDescription: Estelle's (Joey's Agent) Office, Joey is there.

lines.Line:
How could I not get the part? The play was about a 29-year-old Italian
actor from Queens
Well, Telia Shire suddenly became available
Well, Telia Shire suddenly became available
What can I say? She nailed it
(Very discouraged) Okay, is there anything else
(Very discouraged) Okay, is there anything else
Well, you’re just going to say no again but...gay porn

3.SceneDescription: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Joey is telling Ross how he didn't get the part.

lines.Line: That part was perfect for me! I can't believe I didn't get it
I'm sorry, man. Hey, y'know what you should do? You should make something happen for yourself. Y'know, like-like write a play. Write a movie! Huh? I mean, what about those Good Will Hunting guys

Come on Ross be realistic, y'know? If I did write something, what are the
chances I could get those guys to star in it

lines.Character: (Ross just stares at him until he figures it out
lines.Line: Ross just stares at him until he figures it out.

lines.Character: (Ross just stares at him until he figures it out
lines.Line: Ross just stares at him until he figures it out.
Wait a second, I could star in it

I can't write! Y'know I mean I-I-I'm an actor, I don't have the discipline
that takes, y'know? I can't do it

I'll help you. Yeah, I'll make up a schedule and make sure you stick to
it. And plus, it'll give me something to do
Really? You'd-you'd do that for me?
Really? You'd-you'd do that for me?

(grabbing a notepad and sitting down) All right, we'll start off slow. The
only thing you have to do tonight is come up with the name of your main character

4.SceneDescription:
Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Joey is trying to write his movie, Chandler is
playing a game on the counter by trying to flip a ping pong ball with a spoon into a
nearby bowl.

lines.Line: Hey, how do you spell suspicious?
Because I think this character is going to be suspicious about stuff
Chandler makes it into the bowl.
Chandler makes it into the bowl.
You're driving me crazy with that
Don’t stop! Move the bowl further away! Ross could make that shot

lines.Character:
(Chandler slides the bowl to the far end of the counter. He tries again, but he hits
the spoon to hard and the ball goes flying away
lines.Line:
Chandler slides the bowl to the far end of the counter. He tries again, but he hits
the spoon to hard and the ball goes flying away.
Well, you suck! But at least you suck at a man's game now

Chandler, I can't be playing games, Ross is gonna be home soon. And I have
to write five whole pages if I'm gonna stick to his schedule

Well, so, play for the next 30 minutes and then write until he gets
home

(jumping up) All right! But uh, listen, what do you say we crank it up a
notch
All right, all we need is a little lighter fluid.

Okay, but be careful okay, because I wanna get our security deposit
back
Yeah, I think we said good-bye to that when we invented hammer darts
Do you even remember which part of the wall is not spackle
Do you even remember which part of the wall is not spackle

Uh yeah, right here. (He punches his fist through the wall next to the
door.

5.SceneDescription: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Ross is reading what Joey wrote.

lines.Line:
All right. (Reading.) A room. A man enters, he looks suspicious. (Stops
reading a flips the page to find the next one is blank.) That's it? (Joey shrugs.) Joey,
you're supposed to have five pages done by now! Including an exciting incident!
(Flipping through the rest of the pad.) And what is, and what is all this?! (Reading.) The
official rulebook of Fireball
Yeah, that's the uh, game we were playing

(entering from his room carrying a fire extinguisher and wearing oven
mitts) Oh yeah, it's great! See you take a tennis ball, a bowl, and some lighter
fluid—Op! Op! (He puts out a small fire which has re-ignited in his room.

This is helping your career?! Huh? I thought you wanted to be an actor not
the creator of crazy lawsuit game
You're right, you're right, I'll get back to work
You're right, you're right, I'll get back to work

(To Chandler) And shame on you! You should know better, Joey needs to
work. (To Joey) Now come on!

lines.Character:
(He tries to fire a burnt tennis ball into the bowl Chandler is standing by, but Ross
grabs the ball away from him
lines.Line:
He tries to fire a burnt tennis ball into the bowl Chandler is standing by, but Ross
grabs the ball away from him.

No! Ah-ah-ah-ah-ah! You can have this back when the five pages are done!
(After Joey walks past, Ross throws the ball down in pain.) Ahh! (Chandler shows him the
burn spots on his oven mitts.

6.SceneDescription:
Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is complaining to Ross and Monica about the
bucket.

lines.Line:
Nobody! Nobody respects the bucket! You wouldn't believe what people put
in here! Look! (Hands it to Monica.) Okay, does this look like a garbage can to you
Does it look like an ashtray
Does it look like a urinal
So Pheebs, are you gonna go back out there or what

Well, yeah! But I'm not gonna take anymore crap. Okay? No more Mrs. Nice
Bucket
Yeah, good for you. Y'know you're tough, you lived on the streets

Yeah, I'm gonna go back to being Street Phoebe. Yeah! Oh but, y'know
what? I can't go totally back because Street Phoebe really wouldn't be friends with you
guys. Sorry. (Leaves.
Hey, umm, can I ask you guys something

Uh, I don't have any brothers so I don't know, but uh, did you guys
wrestle
All the time. In fact, I was undefeated
Still, I was quick as a cat

Well, I met Danny's sister yesterday, and uh that was actually the girl
on the subway
Yeah, they were very y'know…wrestley. But, I guess that's normal
(laughing with Ross) We don't, we don't wrestle now
Yeah, not since I got too strong for you
Yeah, not since I got too strong for you

You wanna go right now? 'Cause I'll take you right now, buddy! You wanna
go

Ready? (They grab a hold of each other's necks.) Wrestle! (They start
wrestling.

Okay, y'know what uh, actually, that's great. That helps a lot. Thanks.
(She leaves them to wrestle.

7.SceneDescription:
Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, Joey, and Chandler are listening to a story being
told by Danny and his sister.

lines.Line:
…so we finally get to the top of the mountain and airhead here (His
sister) forgets the camera
Oh, y'know the same thing happened to me one time
When did that happen to you?
When did that happen to you?

Don't you remember when we were jogging in the park and we saw that really
pretty bird and wanted to take a picture—I didn't have my camera
Oh yeah. First off all, chasing the Churo guy isn't jogging

Oh, this is so good (A piece of cake.) you have got to try it. (She
takes some on her finger and feeds it to Danny. Then takes a little more and does it
again. Meanwhile, the rest of the gang stares on in shock. Then they pick up a part of it
and some filling falls into his lap.
Oh, damn! I got it on my pants
Oh, damn! I got it on my pants
Oh, damn! I got it on my pants

Here, I'll get it. (She grabs a napkin and tries to wipe it up. The
thing that gets the rest of the gang going is that she's whipping awfully close to his
crotch. In fact, she is whipping his crotch. Chandler's about to come out of his chair.
We'd better take these pants off upstairs or that stain's gonna set
Yep. (To Rachel) I'm gonna wear these on our date tonight
Yep. (To Rachel) I'm gonna wear these on our date tonight
Okay, bye! (To the gang.) Oh my God!
I don't believe they're brother and sister

8.SceneDescription: Danny's apartment, there's a knock on the door and he answers it.

lines.Line: Oh, hey Rach! I thought we said seven
Yeah uh, y'know what uh, let's skip it

Umm, you-you and your sister seem to have umm, a very special bond,
and

Oh great! That special bond again! Why do women have such a
problem with the fact that I'm close with my sister

Well, okay, look. I don't know, listen, I don't know what's going on
here but let's
Do-do you, do you have brothers
Do-do you, do you have brothers
Do-do you, do you have brothers
No, I have two sisters. But one of them has a very masculine energy
No-no, they're not very nice people
No-no, they're not very nice people

Okay, listen, I really like you. Okay? I think this can go somewhere. So
what if I'm close to my family, are you gonna let that stand in the way of us

Well, uh, I-I don't know. See when-when you put it that way y'know it
does sort of
(calling from the bathroom) Danny! Hurry up! The bath is getting cold
Yeah, okay, I'll see you later. (Gets up and runs from the apartment.

Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are about to read another one of Joey's

lines.Line:
(Reading the scene set up.) Okay, it's a typical New York City apartment.
Two girls are just hanging out

lines.Character: (Monica and Rachel begin to read from the script
lines.Line: Monica and Rachel begin to read from the script.
Hi, how are you doing Kelly
Hi, how are you doing Kelly
I'm doing just fine! God, Tiffany, you smell so great

It's my new perfume. Why don't you come closer where you can really
appreciate it
They both start to read ahead.
They both start to read ahead.
They both start to read ahead.
Oh, y'know Joey, you are sick

lines.Character: (They both throw the scripts in his face
